raw_comment:
1. What do you notice?
I noticed that this graph breaks down peoples ages and surveys whether or not they think that generations to come will make the world a better place or not. I also noticed that people aged 25-39 were not surveyed. 
2. What do you wonder?
I wonder why Indonesia’s results are so high and why Brazil and Mali's results are so low. I wonder if their location impacted their results. I also wonder if these results will change in the future or how these results would have compared to the past. 
3. What impact does this have on you and your community?
This impacts me because I am in the 15-24 year old category in the U.S. and I think that the world will be a better place with each generation. Also, I think that my community is very optimistic so they will do everything in  their power to make changes so the world can be a better place. 
4. What's going on in this graph? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph's main idea.
In this graph, we see a graph that displays how different aged people think whether or not the world is getting better with each generation. A catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea would be “Will younger generations help make the world a better place in the future?”
ace_sentences: This graph breaks down the ages of people.
This graph surveys whether people think that future generations will make the world a better place.
People who are 25-39 years old were not surveyed.
I wonder why the results for Indonesia are very high.
I wonder why the results for Brazil are very low.
I wonder why the results for Mali are very low.
I wonder whether the location of a country impacted the results of the country.
I wonder whether these results will change in the future.
I wonder how these results compare to results in the past.
I am in the 15-24 age category in the US.
I think that the world will be a better place with each generation.
I think that my community is very optimistic.
If my community is very optimistic then my community will do everything in its power to make changes.
If my community makes changes then the world can be a better place.
This graph displays how people of different ages think about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
The headline is: Will younger generations help make the world a better place in the future?
